title.narrative: Supporting the survival and inclusion of 2,000 disabled children in Uganda

description.narrative: Disabled people are the poorest of the poor. Their rights and needs are invariably ignored and they are not specifically included in the MDG targets. This project will empower mothers and caregivers of children with cerebral palsy to impact their child’s health and survival, and their access to education and inclusion in society. It will seek to improve maternal health practice, establish professional wheelchair services, and provide access to economic empowerment opportunities. ;

recipient-country.narrative: 100% of project activities are in Uganda
